item.title: How To Watch the 2025 Seattle Mariners Season
item.dc:creator: David Vick
item.description:
Will this season be a home run for the Mariners? Learn how to watch Seattle Mariners baseball with our guide, featuring their TV schedule and channel lineup.

The post How To Watch the 2025 Seattle Mariners Season appeared first on CableTV.com.
item.content:encoded:
How hard is it to make the MLB playoffs when you play in the American League? Just ask the Seattle Mariners. Since 2001, they’ve had 11 winning seasons. Yet only one of those led to a playoff appearance.

But the Mariners managed to make 2025 a successful season after qualifying for the American League Divisional Series. They start play Saturday, October 4 against the Cleveland Guardians.

Even though the matchup and times of the ALDS are yet to be announced, I’ve put together a watch guide for this round of the playoffs and beyond with what we know so far. Keep checking back on this page as more information becomes available.

Jump to:

  • Seattle Mariners channels
  • Seattle Mariners TV schedule
  • Best Mariners TV plans

Want more TV sports coverage?

Subscribe to CableTV.com’s email newsletter for the latest event-viewing guides, entertaining takes, and money-saving promotions.

By signing up, you agree to our Privacy Policy & Terms and Conditions.

What channels have Seattle Mariners games?

ROOT SPORTS is the regional home for Seattle Mariners broadcasts in 2025. Apple TV+, ESPN, FOX, MLB Network, and The Roku Channel will also televise a handful of Mariners games.

Out-of-market fans who want to watch regional broadcasts this year will need MLB.TV or MLB EXTRA INNINGS to do so.

Want radio coverage? The Mariners Radio Network offers listening options to fans in Washington, Oregon, Idaho, Alaska, and British Columbia. Fans in those states and Montana can also listen to games on the Seattle Sports 710 AM app or the Seattle Sports website.

Spanish-language audio is available for all Mariners home games through SAP channels on most of the cable and satellite providers that carry the ROOT SPORTS channel.

2025 Seattle Mariners playoffs TV schedule

After exorcising some two-decade-old demons, the Mariners are finally back in the American League Championship Series. They got here by winning a tough, five-game battle against the Tigers. That series saw Seattle claim its first home playoff victory since 2001.

Now, the focus shifts to a best-of-seven showdown against the Toronto Blue Jays. To help you follow every moment, I’ve laid out the complete playoff TV schedule below, and I’ll be keeping it updated with all the latest broadcast info moving forward.

Best TV plans for watching the Seattle Mariners

Mariners fans in the Pacific Northwest have two excellent viewing options for the 2025 MLB season: a direct-to-consumer (DTC) package or a standard TV provider. I’ll go over the positives of each to help make your viewing decision easier.

ROOT SPORTS Stream ($19.99/mo.)

If you think you need a cable or satellite subscription to watch the Mariners on TV in 2025, think again. ROOT SPORTS Stream—the exclusive DTC viewing option for local fans—broadcasts almost every game the Mariners will play this season. The monthly price is unbeatable, and you can watch games on the app or online while traveling outside the Mariners’ TV market for up to 30 days. This is what I call a winning deal!

Fubo ($14.99–$94.99/mo.)

Not many TV providers carry ROOT SPORTS in their channel lineup. Luckily, Fubo does. If you’re an in-market fan, all you need is a good internet connection and a compatible device to subscribe.

The main drawback to watching local Mariners games on a TV provider is the regional sports fee, and Fubo isn’t very transparent about this extra cost. Aside from that, there’s a lot to like about Fubo, including its unlimited recording capabilities. That comes in handy during a 162-game season.

Score the best TV plan!

Enter your zip code below to see your area’s top TV providers

How to watch the Seattle Mariners FAQ

Can I watch the Seattle Mariners for free?

Yes, you can watch the Seattle Mariners for free with an over-the-air antenna when games air on channels like FOX. Check out the FCC’s Reception Map Tool to find the channels that are available where you live.

Is ROOT SPORTS a regional sports network?

Yes, ROOT SPORTS is a regional sports network that provides coverage to fans in Washington, Oregon, Montana, Alaska, and parts of Idaho.

What channel is ROOT SPORTS on?

The channel that ROOT SPORTS is on depends on your TV provider and your location. Use the ROOT SPORTS Channel Finder tool to see which channel you can watch Mariners games on.

Where can I download the ROOT SPORTS Stream app?

You can download the ROOT SPORTS Stream app on Apple and Android devices, as well as several other streaming platforms and smart TVs.

Are the Mariners playing on Sunday Night Baseball in 2025?

Yes, the Mariners are playing on ESPN’s Sunday Night Baseball in 2025. They’ll be facing the Mets in the MLB Little League Classic on Sunday, August 17.

Why you should trust us

I created this watch guide after nearly four hours of research into the Seattle Mariners’ 2025 broadcast schedule. It includes every channel the Mariners will play on this MLB season, ways to watch the team, their full regular-season schedule, and a detailed FAQ section.

Learn more about CableTV.com’s methods by checking out our How We Rank page.

item.title: How To Watch the 2025 Toronto Blue Jays Season
item.dc:creator: Ian McLaren
item.description:
Learn how to watch Toronto Blue Jays baseball on TV with our guide, featuring game times, channel listings, and streaming options.

The post How To Watch the 2025 Toronto Blue Jays Season appeared first on CableTV.com.
item.content:encoded:
In professional sports, few things are more frustrating than unfulfilled potential, and Toronto Blue Jays fans have felt that sting more than once in recent years. Despite a talented core and multiple playoff appearances from 2015 to 2023, the team never managed to make a deep postseason run. Big expectations often turned into big letdowns.

Then came 2025, and the Blue Jays turned out to be one of the best teams in the Show.

Toronto won 94 games and earned a spot in the American League Championship Series. The Blue Jays will play the winner of the Wild Card series between the Seattle Mariners and Detroit Tigers.

If you’re a Toronto fan who’s been itching to see if the Blue Jays can make a deep playoff run this year, I’ll show you how you can catch every playoff game on TV.

Jump to:

  • Toronto Blue Jays channels
  • Toronto Blue Jays TV schedule
  • Best Toronto Blue Jays TV plans

Want more TV sports coverage?

Subscribe to CableTV.com’s email newsletter for the latest event-viewing guides, entertaining takes, and money-saving promotions.

By signing up, you agree to our Privacy Policy & Terms and Conditions.

What channels have Toronto Blue Jays games?

How to watch in the United States

In the U.S., Toronto Blue Jays games are available out-of-market via MLB.TV, since U.S. viewers don’t fall within the Canadian blackout territory.

Nationally televised games (on channels like ESPN, FOX, FS1, and TBS) are available to U.S. fans via live TV providers or streaming services. But MLB.TV doesn’t include those live broadcasts.

How to watch in Canada

In Canada, the Toronto Blue Jays are exclusively broadcast through Sportsnet and its related feeds like Sportsnet One and Sportsnet 360. The network covers nearly every game throughout the regular season and postseason.

For French-speaking fans, TVA Sports (via a sub-licensing arrangement with Sportsnet) carries French-language broadcasts of Blue Jays games and some national MLB content in Canada.

Occasional Friday night Blue Jays games are exclusive to Apple TV+, which aren’t available through Sportsnet or Sportsnet+.

Want radio coverage? The Blue Jays’ flagship radio station is Sportsnet 590 The Fan (CJCL AM 590) in Toronto, with coverage available across southern Ontario. It simulcasts most games and is carried on satellite and digital platforms.

2025 Toronto Blue Jays playoff TV schedule

The Blue Jays finished the regular season as champions of the AL East for the first time since 2015, securing a first-round bye and home-field advantage. The team then defeated the archrival New York Yankees in the Division Series, earning the franchise’s first American League Championship Series appearance since 2016.

Now, they face the Seattle Mariners in a rare ALCS matchup. Below is the full U.S. playoff TV schedule as it’s currently known, with all games will air on Sportsnet in Canada. I’ll keep the table updated as soon as more information comes out.

Best TV plans for watching the Toronto Blue Jays

Canada: Score a standalone in-market TV package for Blue Jays games

If you’re a local fan in Canada who wants to stream games without a cable package, Sportsnet+ is your best bet. A subscription gives you access to nearly every regular-season Blue Jays game that isn’t nationally televised. Once subscribed, you can watch online or via the Sportsnet app on your preferred device.

Just don’t forget to add Apple TV+ to your setup if you want to catch the exclusive Friday Night Baseball games, which often feature the Blue Jays. That applies to fans in both Canada and the U.S.

United States: Get MLB.TV and a live TV service

For U.S.-based fans looking to watch the Toronto Blue Jays throughout the 2025 season, the most complete and convenient setup is a combination of MLB.TV and a live TV streaming service.

MLB.TV is the best way to watch nearly every Blue Jays game, since they’re considered an out-of-market team in the U.S. This means you can stream all regular-season games live or on demand, with the exception of those that air nationally on channels like ESPN or FOX.

To cover those national broadcasts, services like Fubo, DIRECTV, or Sling TV are your best bets.

  • Fubo: A top choice for sports fans, Fubo offers access to ESPN, FOX, FS1, and more, along with the option to integrate your MLB.TV subscription directly into the platform for a seamless viewing experience.
  • DIRECTV: DIRECTV’s streaming option also offers full access to national channels and supports MLB.TV as an add-on, making it a solid traditional alternative.
  • Sling TV: For a more budget-friendly approach, Sling TV with both the Orange and Blue packages plus the Sports Extra add-on gives you access to ESPN, TBS, FS1, and MLB Network. Keep in mind you’ll need to manage MLB.TV separately.

Find the best service in your area

Enter your zip code below to see your area’s top TV providers.

How to watch the Toronto Blue Jays FAQ

How can I watch the Toronto Blue Jays for free?

To watch the Toronto Blue Jays for free, your best bet is to sign up for a Sportsnet+ free trial in Canada, or a Fubo or DIRECTV free trial in the U.S. for nationally televised games. You can also check MLB.TV’s Free Game of the Day, which occasionally features the Blue Jays at no cost.

How can American viewers watch the Blue Jays most effectively?

In the U.S., the best way to watch the Blue Jays is with MLB.TV, which includes nearly every out-of-market game. Pair it with Apple TV+ for Friday exclusives and a live TV service (like Fubo or Sling TV) for games on ESPN, FOX, FS1, or MLB Network. This combo ensures full-season coverage.

Why should American fans care about the only MLB team north of the border?

The Blue Jays feature a star-studded lineup with names like Vladimir Guerrero Jr. and Bo Bichette, plus they’re constant playoff contenders. Their games often feature thrilling matchups against top AL East rivals—and the newly renovated Rogers Centre is one of baseball’s most unique ballparks.

Why you should trust us

As an Ontario resident, lifelong Blue Jays fan, and a Sportsnet subscriber who also has Apple TV+ for the Friday games, I understand firsthand the challenges of navigating MLB broadcast options.

I’ve used that experience to make this guide as helpful and practical as possible for fellow Jays fans.

I created this watch guide with the specific viewing needs of Toronto Blue Jays fans in mind.

After spending a few hours researching the most up-to-date broadcast schedule for the Blue Jays’ 2025 season, I determined the most ideal and affordable viewing options for fans. Before publishing, I carefully reviewed every detail in this guide to ensure its accuracy and completeness.

Check out CableTV.com’s How We Rank page to learn more about our methods.

Game day starts here!

  • How To Watch CFL Games
  • Best Streaming Services for Sports

item.title: How To Watch the 2025 MLB Playoffs
item.dc:creator: Taylor Kujawa
item.description:
ABC, FOX, FS1, TBS, ESPN, and ESPN2 are home to MLB postseason games, and we’ve outlined the best TV providers for tuning in.

The post How To Watch the 2025 MLB Playoffs appeared first on CableTV.com.
item.content:encoded:
The 2025 MLB Playoffs begin on Tuesday, September 30, and culminate with the 121st edition of the World Series, which starts Friday, October 24. You can watch playoff games on popular baseball channels from ESPN, FOX Sports, and TNT Sports, though channel lineups vary across each round.

American League fans should have FOX and FS1 locked and loaded for key matchups. However, National League followers will need access to TNT Sports channels like TBS and truTV, or a subscription to HBO Max, to catch that side of the postseason bracket.

Scroll down to see which TV providers carry these channels and how you can watch some playoff action for free.

Jump to:

  • MLB Playoffs channels
  • MLB Playoffs TV schedule
  • Watch the MLB Playoffs for free

Get the most MLB action on TV!

Enter your zip code below to browse your area’s top TV and internet providers.

What channels are the MLB Playoffs on?

The 2025 MLB Playoffs will likely air across six channels, based on last year’s schedule:

  • ABC
  • FOX
  • FS1
  • TBS
  • truTV
  • ESPN
  • ESPN2

Most MLB playoff channels are easy to find from various TV providers, but you may need a higher-tier TV plan to access specific networks. Additionally, ESPN Deportes, Fox Deportes, MLB Network, truTV, UniMás, and Univision will carry Spanish-language postseason coverage.

Pro tip: All games airing on FOX and FS1 will stream on FOX One, while TBS games will stream on HBO Max’s Standard and Premium plans. But it’s important to note that you might not need every playoff channel listed above, especially if you’re only tuning in for a specific team.

MLB Playoffs TV schedule

The 2025 MLB Playoffs begin in late September, starting with the Wild Card Series. After that, the action moves to the divisional and league series. The 121st World Series begins in late October.

See the first table below to find out when each series starts and which channels you can watch them on. Then, for a more comprehensive look at each series, click on the drop-down menus a little further down. I’ll be updating the schedules as the postseason unfolds.

Best TV plans for watching the MLB Playoffs

Now that you know the channels you’ll need to watch this year’s playoffs, you have a better idea of what to look for when choosing a TV provider. But we’ll make it a step easier. Here’s a list of our three favorite postseason TV plans.

  • Antenna: You can catch every playoff game airing on ABC and FOX using an over-the-air (OTA) antenna, as long as you’re within range of a local affiliate station. Check out our Watch For Free section below for more on this viewing option.
  • Sling TV + Antenna: Sling TV is the most affordable option for watching the MLB Playoffs because its Sling Orange + Blue plan offers FS1, TBS, and ESPN for just $60.99/mo.. While it lacks nationwide coverage for ABC and FOX, you can still stream ABC games through ESPN3 and use an antenna for FOX broadcasts.
  • YouTube TV: At $82.99/mo., YouTube TV is an excellent service for streaming the MLB Postseason. You’ll get every playoff channel and sick features like multiview and unlimited DVR storage. We typically don’t recommend YouTube TV during the MLB regular season because it lacks MLB Network and crucial regional sports networks. But that won’t affect your viewing experience during the playoffs.

Which TV providers offer MLB playoff channels?

Most major TV providers offer the core MLB playoff networks, covering everything from the Wild Card Series to the World Series. Our table below highlights 13 popular providers and whether they carry the necessary channels.

Because the MLB Playoffs air across several basic cable networks, you’ll need a TV subscription to access the entire slate of playoff games. Some live TV streaming services offer free trials, but most don’t last longer than seven days.

You can watch a slice of playoff action without subscribing to a TV plan using an OTA antenna on your smart TV. Since ABC and FOX air various playoff games, you can tune in for free through your local network affiliates. That’s especially important since FOX will show the complete World Series.

If you need a high-quality antenna, we suggest checking out the Mohu Leaf 50. It’s one of our favorite antennas because of its 60-mile range and 4K capabilities. Though, you’ll want to enter your zip code on the FCC’s Reception Map Tool before committing to an antenna. That way, you can ensure ABC and FOX stations are within range of your home.

How to watch the MLB Playoffs FAQ

What app can I watch the MLB Playoffs on?

If you already have access to MLB playoff channels through a TV provider, you can watch live games through individual channel apps like ESPN, FOX Sports, and TBS. All you need to do is sign in to each app with your TV provider credentials. You can also watch the MLB Playoffs through the MLB app, but you’ll need an eligible TV provider login for live game access.

How can I watch the MLB Playoffs without cable?

Without cable, you can watch the entire MLB Playoffs through most live TV streaming services. We recommend Sling TV because it’s the cheapest way to get ESPN, FS1, and TBS in one plan (Sling Orange + Blue at $60.99/mo.), but you’ll likely need an antenna for FOX coverage.

Does Amazon Prime have the MLB Playoffs?

No, a basic Amazon Prime Video subscription doesn’t include nationally televised MLB games like the MLB Playoffs. But you can watch some MLB coverage through Prime Video using add-ons like HBO Max Standard and MLB.TV.

How can I watch the MLB Playoffs in Canada?

In Canada, you can watch live MLB Postseason and World Series games on Sportsnet. The most straightforward way to tune in is with a standard Sportsnet+ subscription. You can also catch Candian French–language coverage on RDS and TVA.

What is the new format for the MLB Playoffs?

The current postseason format launched in 2022 when the MLB expanded to a six-team American League and National League playoff bracket. Now, the Wild Card round is a best-of-three series instead of a single-elimination game, and the top two division winners of each league receive byes into the Division Series. Check out the MLB’s Postseason Format Explainer for a closer look at how it all works.

Why you should trust us

Our baseball experts researched the best ways to watch the MLB Playoffs by comparing the most popular TV providers head to head. We based our viewing recommendations primarily on ease of use—focusing on each provider’s channel lineups, pricing, and set-up process.

Check out our How We Rank page to learn more about our methods.

item.title: How Many Americans Have Forgotten to Cancel a Streaming Free Trial? New Study Shocks the Experts.
item.dc:creator: Olivia Bono
item.description:
Most people have signed up for a streaming service’s free trial, and a lot of people intend to cancel once the promo period is over. But not everyone remembers to do so.

The post How Many Americans Have Forgotten to Cancel a Streaming Free Trial? New Study Shocks the Experts. appeared first on CableTV.com.
item.content:encoded:
“Free” doesn’t always mean “free”

Free trials are a great way to binge-watch a show you’re interested in without committing to a full service. And with rising streaming service prices, it’s getting harder to maintain subscriptions to every service just for a few exclusives.

But you have to be careful with free trials—they’re only free as long as you remember to cancel them before they’re over.

If you’ve ever forgotten to cancel a free trial, you’re not alone. More people have made that mistake than you’d think, and it’s what subscription services are counting on! So we surveyed 1,000 people to see exactly how many are in the same boat.

Who forgets to cancel trials? More people than you think.

About half (48.0%) of Americans have forgotten to cancel a free trial and accidentally paid more than they expected. And not everyone is able to learn from this mistake—another 48.1% of those people have had it happen multiple times.

Maybe that’s why 43.7% of people feel they overspend on streaming services.

How much money have you accidentally spent on streaming trials?

Of the 470 people who admitted to accidentally letting a trial expire, 43.7% said they’ve been charged $20–$50. And 9% of people have spent over $100 on accidental subscriptions. That’s like a tenth of an iPhone!

Pro tip: When you sign up for a free trial, set a reminder on your phone or in your calendar. Set it a day or two before the trial expires—some services are tricky about deadlines—and commit to canceling if you think you don’t want to subscribe long term.

When should you cancel your free trial?

Luckily for you, we’ve kept tabs on some of the most popular streaming trials, including their fine print. You don’t even have to dig through our archives to find the good stuff—I’ve done the work for you. Here’s a quick overview of each service.

Streaming service free trials can range from 3 to 30 days

Service Trial length Details
Amazon Prime Video 30 days Read more
Apple TV+ 7 days Read more
ESPN+ 3 days Read more
HBO Max 7 days Read more
Hulu 30 days Read more
Paramount+ 7 days Read more

Data effective as of post date.

Even if you cancel, most streaming services will let you keep watching your content until the end of your free trial or your next billing date. However, a couple of services are a little stingier: ESPN+ and Amazon Prime Video. Both will cut you off as soon as you cancel, so make sure you’ve watched everything you wanted before you hit that button.

ESPN+ and Prime Video cut you off as soon as you cancel, so be sure to watch everything you want before you hit the unsubscribe button.

Some of these services, like HBO Max and Peacock, might beg you to stay. This is actually good news! If a service is desperate to keep your business, they might send you a discount. Check out our Cancellation Deals Guide for a list of the deals we know of.

Still have questions? Click on the “read more” button in the table above to read our guides to signing up for (and canceling) each listed service.

Our methods

For this survey, we used Pollfish to ask 1000 Americans aged 18 and over to share their spending habits and answer other questions about streaming services. We then stratified results to account for gender and generational composition. This survey took place earlier in 2025.

Why you should trust us

We’re no strangers to a survey at CableTV.com. We pride ourselves in our curiosity, and we’re always curious to see what customers really think about the streaming services we review. That’s why we run a yearly Customer Satisfaction Survey and take real testimonials into account when ranking products and services. For more on our process, head over to our How We Rank page.

Related articles

  • Why You Should Cancel Your Disney Bundle Subscription
  • The State of Late-Night TV

The post How Many Americans Have Forgotten to Cancel a Streaming Free Trial? New Study Shocks the Experts. appeared first on CableTV.com.

item.title: My Must-Watch List: The 5 Best Disney Movies to Watch for Halloween
item.dc:creator: Sophie Hastings
item.description:
Get ready for ‘Hocus Pocus’ and ‘Halloweentown’! Our top five Disney Halloween picks mix cozy chills, campy witchcraft, and family-friendly frights for the perfect October marathon.

The post My Must-Watch List: The 5 Best Disney Movies to Watch for Halloween appeared first on CableTV.com.
item.content:encoded:
Why Disney is my coziest kind of creepy

I love how Disney does spooky season: more cackle than carnage. I’m here for pumpkin-glow vibes, quotable one-liners, and costumes I actually want to wear on October 31. When I want a family-friendly marathon that still feels festive, these five picks always make my queue.

Looking for even more picks? Don’t miss TV critic Randy Harward’s weekly What To Watch guide for the freshest streaming recs.

Looking for the hottest entertainment?

Subscribe to CableTV.com’s email newsletter for the latest TV event viewing guides, entertaining takes, and money-saving promotions.

By signing up, you agree to our Privacy Policy & Terms and Conditions.

1. Hocus Pocus (1993)

Every October, I light (figuratively!) the Black Flame Candle and let the Sanderson sisters wreak delightful havoc. I come back for the camp, the chaos, and the Halloween-night countdown energy that makes the whole movie feel like a ritual.

Where to watch Hocus Pocus

Watch Options

2. Halloweentown (1998)

I grew up wishing I could hop on a broom to Halloweentown. Following Marnie Piper into a pumpkin-lit parallel city still gives me that “Halloween should be every day” feeling—and I happily lean into the grandma-witch wisdom every time.

Where to watch Halloweentown

Watch Options

3. The Nightmare Before Christmas (1993)

When I want stop-motion splendor and sing-along spooks, I visit Jack Skellington. I love how this one bridges my Halloween mood and my early holiday itch, so I slot it in the week leading up to the 31st.

Where to watch The Nightmare Before Christmas

Watch Options

4. Twitches (2005)

On nights when I want sparkly magic and sisterly shenanigans, I pick Tia and Tamera’s Twitches. The sweet-sixteen destiny twist still charms me. And yes, I admire the costume changes every time.

Where to watch Twitches

Watch Options

5. Frankenweenie (2012)

When I want heartfelt with my haunting, I choose Frankenweenie. Tim Burton’s black-and-white love letter to classic creature features reminds me that sometimes the best Halloween monsters are stitched together with love.

Where to watch Frankenweenie

Watch Options

The post My Must-Watch List: The 5 Best Disney Movies to Watch for Halloween appeared first on CableTV.com.

The U.S. Men’s National Soccer Team (USMNT) officially dates back to 1916. Despite its long history, the national team has never won the FIFA Men’s World Cup. Its biggest tournament wins have come in the CONCACAF Gold Cup and Nations League.

As we approach the 2026 World Cup, there’s no better time to start following the USMNT. Mauricio Pochettino has taken charge, and the team is ready to step up its game. That’s why we’ve gathered all the necessary details to watch the team in action.

Keep scrolling for a complete look at the U.S. men’s soccer schedule, channel listings, and recommended TV services.

Jump to:

  • USMNT channels
  • USMNT TV schedule

Subscribe to CableTV.com’s email newsletter for the latest event-viewing guides, entertaining takes, and money-saving promotions.

By signing up, you agree to our Privacy Policy & Terms and Conditions.

What channels have USMNT games?

You can watch most USMNT games on FOX, FS1, TBS, and TNT. But you may need access to streaming services HBO Max and Paramount+ for complete English-language coverage.

Spanish-language channels like Telemundo, TUDN, UniMás, UNIVERSO, and Univision also show USMNT games. At the same time, most USMNT matchups stream en Español across Peacock and ViX.

USMNT TV schedule

The USMNT competes at various times throughout the year, usually during international windows established by FIFA. But most of the national team’s high-profile matchups happen during the summer.

Stay up to date on all the action with the USMNT schedule listed below, featuring upcoming kickoff times and channel details.

Hulu + Live TV is our favorite way to get the traditional TV channels that show USMNT matches. Starting at $81.99 a month, the live TV streaming service is not cheap. But it’s perfect for those who want U.S. Soccer coverage alongside popular entertainment networks.

Hulu + Live TV’s FOX Sports channels set you up for every World Cup and Gold Cup game. You’ll also get select USMNT and USWNT friendlies through TBS and TNT. As a bonus, the service includes every ESPN channel and ESPN+ at no extra cost, giving you access to many soccer leagues from around the globe.

Unfortunately, watching U.S. Soccer on Hulu + Live TV means you’ll miss out on games that stream exclusively on HBO Max and Paramount+. But you can get standalone subscriptions to both services and cancel anytime.

HBO Max entered the live sports scene in early 2023 by streaming live USMNT and USWNT friendlies—including the SheBelieves Cup. While it had some initial hiccups, the Warner Bros. Discovery platform gradually resolved its issues. Unfortunately, watching live sports on HBO Max requires a higher-tier plan, so you’ll need a Standard or Premium base plan to access its B/R Sports hub.

International friendlies don’t happen regularly throughout the year. Therefore, committing to an annual HBO Max subscription for live soccer is not the most cost-effective choice. But HBO Max offers an extensive library of on-demand TV shows and movies to keep you entertained between match days.

HBO Max is pricier than other on-demand streaming services. So, if you’re seeking a cheaper alternative, we recommend Peacock. For $10.99 per month, Peacock streams the same U.S. Soccer games with Spanish-language commentary—more on that in the next section.

Peacock is a fantastic option for watching U.S. Soccer games, offering affordability and diverse competitions. It’s home to U.S. Soccer’s international friendlies and FIFA’s World Cup tournaments with Spanish-language commentary. Plus, it offers complete access to the Summer Olympics—featuring men’s and women’s soccer events.

Beyond national team coverage, Peacock streams a wide array of live sports. There are Sunday Night Football games, Premier League matches, PGA Tour tournaments, and more. In other words, don’t sleep on Peacock. It’s a major contender in the streaming sports category, rivaling the likes of ESPN+.

There isn’t an easy way to watch USMNT matchups for free. But you can watch occasional games without a TV subscription by using an over-the-air (OTA) antenna to pick up your local FOX station.

FOX is responsible for showing Gold Cup and World Cup matches. Because those competitions don’t happen annually, FOX’s U.S. Soccer coverage is inconsistent. But having an OTA antenna is still useful for watching MLS, Premier League, and UEFA Champions League games.

Before choosing an antenna, enter your zip code on the FCC’s Reception Map. The tool will help illustrate which channels are available in your area and the type of antenna range you need. Then, head to our Best OTA Antennas page to browse a diverse selection of antennas.

Hulu + Live TV is the best for watching men’s soccer

The USMNT plays in many competitions—including international friendlies and (sometimes) World Cup fixtures. The channels and streaming platforms showing games vary based on the competition type and your language preference. Most national team games air across FOX, FS1, TBS, and TNT, but you may also need HBO Max and Paramount+ to round out your English-language coverage.

Hulu + Live TV is great for watching USMNT games that air on traditional channels. The live TV streaming service even comes with ESPN+ and unlimited DVR storage for an enhanced viewing experience. However, Hulu + Live TV plans start at $81.99 a month, so adding HBO Max and Paramount+ to your lineup makes things exceptionally pricey.

If you want to save money, a combination of Peacock Premium ($10.99 a month) and ViX Premium ($4.99–$8.99 a month) will get you most USMNT games with Spanish-language commentary. You’ll also get access to several other live soccer matches and a wide selection of on-demand TV shows and movies.

How to watch the USMNT FAQ

Who is televising US soccer?

CBS Sports, FOX Sports, and Warner Bros. Discovery Sports are the main English-language broadcasters for games involving U.S. national soccer teams. The specific channels and streaming platforms that air these matches vary depending on the type of competition. For example, all international friendlies stream on HBO Max, while World Cup games air on FOX and FS1.

How can I watch USA soccer on my phone?

There isn’t a single app that streams every USA international soccer game. But you can watch matches on your phone or tablet through live TV streaming services like Hulu + Live TV, Sling TV, and YouTube TV. Select matchups also stream on HBO Max, Paramount+, and Peacock.

Can I watch US soccer without cable?

Yes, you can watch USMNT and USWNT games with any live TV streaming service that carries channels like FOX, FS1, and TNT. Standalone streaming services like HBO Max, Paramount+, and Peacock also show live U.S. national soccer matches.

Why you should trust us

Our experts conducted extensive research and hands-on testing to identify the best ways to watch USMNT games on TV. We compiled a comprehensive list of channels airing U.S. Soccer games and upcoming international competitions. With that information, we compared TV providers based on channel lineups, pricing, and user-friendliness.

Check out our How We Rank page to learn more about our methods.

Pros

  • Key U.S. Soccer channels
  • ESPN+ and Disney+ included
  • Unlimited cloud DVR

Cons

  • Small sports channel lineup
  • Only two simultaneous streams allowed

We consider Hulu + Live TV the best TV service for watching the USWNT due to its impressive features and channel offerings.

Starting at $81.99 a month, the live TV streaming service is a fantastic option for those transitioning from cable or satellite TV. It’s home to a comprehensive array of traditional networks—including important USWNT channels—and provides an excellent blend of sports and entertainment content.

The standout advantage of Hulu + Live TV is that it includes ESPN+ and Disney+ for no extra cost. You’ll also have access to CBS Sports Network and ESPN for more soccer coverage, like NWSL and women’s college soccer matchups.

While Hulu + Live TV covers most USWNT games, some exclusive matches stream on HBO Max and Paramount+. HBO Max is particularly beneficial for watching every SheBelieves Cup game in February, but we’ll delve deeper into the service in the next section.

Exclusive U.S. Soccer Games: HBO Max

Pros

  • Every USWNT and USMNT friendly
  • Large TV and movie library

Cons

  • Limited live sports
  • Expensive pricing

HBO Max hosts 20+ live USWNT and USMNT friendlies annually through its B/R Sports hub. Most of these games also air on Warner Bros. Discovery channels like TBS, TNT, and truTV. But HBO Max is an easy way for national team fans to tune in without a comprehensive TV plan.

Live Sports on HBO Max provides significant advantages to women’s soccer enthusiasts, as it streams the entire SheBelieves Cup—including matches not involving the USWNT. Additionally, HBO Max boasts an extensive library of TV shows and movies. Subscribers can enjoy content like the pay discrimination documentary LFG and Angel City FC’s self-titled docuseries chronicling their inaugural NWSL season.

Unfortunately, to watch live sports on HBO Max, you must have its Standard or Premium base plan. And that won’t get you every USWNT game. The FIFA Women’s World Cup, CONCACAF W Gold Cup, and CONCACAF W Championship have domestic TV agreements with other broadcasters. But for as low as $16.99 a month, HBO Max with its live sports catalogue is still a worthy addition to any streaming lineup.

  • No CONCACAF tournament coverage

If you prefer Spanish-language commentary, Peacock streams all USWNT friendlies and the entire FIFA Women’s World Cup en Español. And best of all, you can get that coverage for as low as $10.99 a month. That’s about two-thirds the cost of HBO Max’s cheapest live sports plan, and it includes more USWNT games.

The soccer coverage on Peacock doesn’t stop there. It’s also the streaming home of the Summer Olympics, so you can watch the men’s and women’s Olympic soccer events every four years. You’ll also get access to many other live sports, hit TV shows, and blockbuster movies.

When Spanish-language USWNT coverage isn’t streaming on Peacock, you’ll likely find games on ViX Premium ($4.99–$8.99 a month). Therefore, getting standalone subscriptions to both services is a superb way to watch the most USWNT matches for the lowest price.

View Peacock Plans

How to watch the USWNT for free

Get Free Local Channels

View on Amazon
Read Mohu Leaf review

*CableTV.com utilizes paid Amazon links. Amazon.com Price; $46.99 (as of 7/25/25 11:20 a.m. CT). Read full disclaimer.

Finding free ways to watch USWNT games can be challenging due to the complexities of international soccer broadcasting agreements. However, there are still opportunities to catch some USWNT matchups without a TV subscription by utilizing an over-the-air (OTA) antenna.

OTA channels like FOX and NBC occasionally broadcast USWNT games, with FOX airing FIFA Women’s World Cup matches and NBC showing the Summer Olympics. Whether the USWNT features in either channel’s coverage depends on the team’s performance in each competition. Nevertheless, having an OTA antenna is handy for watching several live sports events—including NWSL and WNBA matches.

Among our recommended antennas, the Mohu Leaf 50 stands out with its impressive 60-mile range and sleek, paper-thin design. However, antennas vary depending on living situations and viewing setups. For a comprehensive selection of antennas tailored to different needs, check out our Best OTA Antennas guide, where you can explore various options.

Pro tip: Enter your address on the Federal Communications Commission’s (FCC) Reception Map Tool to confirm which channels are available in your area.

Hulu + Live TV is the best for watching US women’s soccer

The TV channel and streaming platform showing USWNT games depend on the competition. During friendlies and SheBelieves Cup action, USWNT matches stream on HBO Max and occasionally air across TBS and TNT. FOX and FS1 air games during FIFA competitions like the Women’s World Cup, while Paramount+ streams the CONCACAF W Championship.

Hulu + Live TV ($81.99–$95.99/mo.) is our favorite way to watch games that air on traditional channels like FOX and TNT. However, you’ll still need standalone services like HBO Max and Paramount+ to get complete coverage during specific years.

If price is a concern, you can watch USWNT games on Peacock ($10.99–$16.99/mo.) and ViX Premium ($4.99–$8.99/mo.). Most U.S. Soccer coverage on those two services streams with Spanish-language commentary, but Peacock will have complete English-language access to the Summer Olympics.

How to watch the USWNT FAQ

Who has the USWNT TV rights?

Warner Bros. Discovery owns the English-language domestic TV rights of the U.S. Soccer Federation. All friendlies and tournaments organized by U.S. Soccer stream on HBO Max and occasionally air on channels like TBS and TNT.

Can I watch US women’s soccer on Paramount+?

Yes, Paramount+ shows USWNT games every four years during the CONCACAF W Championship. The streaming service also carries many NWSL games.

Can I watch the USWNT without cable?

Yes, you can watch the USWNT without cable using any live TV streaming service that has FOX, FS1, TBS, and TNT. Additional English-language coverage streams on standalone services like HBO Max, Paramount+, and Peacock.

Why you should trust us

Our soccer experts conducted extensive research and hands-on testing to identify the best ways to watch the USWNT on TV. We compiled a comprehensive list of channels and services broadcasting upcoming U.S. Soccer games. Then, we compared popular TV services’ game counts, channel lineups, and pricing before determining our viewing recommendations.

Check out our How We Rank page to learn more about our methods.

item.title: How To Watch the 2025–2026 NBA G League Season
item.dc:creator: Eric Chiu
item.description:
Want to track your NBA team’s most interesting prospects? Here’s how to watch NBA G League games this year.

The post How To Watch the 2025–2026 NBA G League Season appeared first on CableTV.com.
item.content:encoded:
From Scoot Henderson to Khris Middleton, the NBA G League has long been a proving ground for hidden gems and future superstars. It’s often the first home for many developmental prospects, laying the foundation for tomorrow’s NBA talent. The 2025–2026 season, which tips off in November, promises to showcase this rising talent as it runs through April.

Whether you’re tracking that promising draft pick your team sent down or following the high-energy local atmosphere, here’s what you need to know about watching the NBA G League this season.

Score the best internet for streaming basketball

Get the fastest NBA streams with a high-end internet connection. Enter your zip code below to see the best internet providers in your area.

1. Get a live TV service

You can watch the 2025–2026 NBA G League regular season on the following channels and platforms:

  • NBAGLeague.com
  • ESPN+
  • NBA TV
  • The Roku Channel
  • Tubi

If you’re interested in NBA G League games, we’d wager that you’re also interested in regular NBA games. In this case, we’d recommend getting DIRECTV STREAM. Along with features like full cable channel lineups and regional sports network coverage, DIRECTV STREAM also includes NBA TV, which will be the home of many NBA G League games.

GET DIRECTV STREAM

2. Sign up for NBA League Pass

Are you stuck on a cable TV plan that doesn’t include NBA TV? NBA League Pass is the easiest a la carte way to add NBA TV to your NBA rotation. The streaming service costs $16.99–$24.99/mo. and includes NBA TV along with full out-of-market game coverage for the entire NBA season. Plus, you can view League Pass on platforms including PlayStation consoles, Apple TVs, and Google TVs.

Check out our NBA League Pass review to learn more about the NBA’s streaming service.

Get NBA League Pass

Want more TV sports coverage?

Subscribe to CableTV.com’s email newsletter for the latest must-watch sporting events, entertaining takes, and money-saving promotions.

By signing up, you agree to our Privacy Policy & Terms and Conditions.

3. Get ESPN+

Along with NBA G League games, ESPN’s streaming service includes exclusive coverage from top ESPN writers like David Shoenfield, live sports games, and original shows. The service typically costs $11.99/mo., but you can get it for free as part of the Disney Bundle, which includes Disney+, Hulu, and ESPN+.

Check out our full ESPN+ review to learn more about the ESPN streaming service.

Get ESPN+

4. Brush up on the NBA G League schedule

If it’s your first time following NBA G League games, remember that its schedule is formatted differently than the NBA. Here are some of the big dates for the 2024–2025 NBA G League season:

Event Start date
NBA G League International Draft July 8, 2025
NBA G League Draft Oct. 25, 2025
NBA G League Tip-Off Tournament Nov. 7, 2025
NBA G League regular season Dec. 19, 2025
NBA G League Playoffs March 31, 2026

Data effective as of post date.

How to watch NBA G League FAQ

Where can I watch NBA G League games?

NBA G League games typically air on ESPN+, NBA TV, Tubi, The Roku Channel, and the NBA G League website. ESPN+ requires a subscription, but NBA TV is available on many cable TV plans and via NBA League Pass.

When does the NBA G League start?

The 2025–2026 NBA G League action begins November 7, with the Tip-Off Tournament. Then, the 36-game regular season begins on December 19.

Are NBA G League games televised?

Yes, most NBA G Leagues are televised on regional sports networks or over-the-air stations within each team's TV market. NBA TV, ESPN+, The Roku Channel, and Tubi also broadcast occasional games nationwide.

How can I watch the NBA G League Playoffs?

The 2026 NBA G League Playoffs will air across ESPNews, ESPNU, and Tubi. Select games may also appear on regional sports platforms, like the FanDuel Sports Network app.

Why you should trust us

Our CableTV.com senior writer, Eric Chiu, researched and tested various ways to watch the NBA G League on TV. He analyzed this season’s schedule and channel listings. Then, he evaluated viewing options across multiple services, determining his top choices based on game quantity, pricing, and ease of use.

Check out our How We Rank page to learn more about our methods.

Game day starts here!
